meanings.definition: A thing whose name is either forgotten or not known.
meanings.sent1: I found a doodah in the drawer, but I can't remember what it's for.
meanings.sent2: She used a doodah to fix the broken toy.
meanings.sent3: The doodah magically appeared in my hand when I needed it most.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a doodah, full of lost memories and forgotten names.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious doodah glowed softly in the dark room.

meanings.sent1: The new doodah can make your life easier with just a click.
meanings.sent2: He always carries a doodah in his pocket for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The doodah beeped loudly, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes widened in amazement as she saw the intricate doodah.
meanings.sent5: The shiny doodah sparkled under the bright lights of the store.

meanings.definition: A placeholder word for something unspecified.
meanings.sent1: Can you pass me that doodah over there?
meanings.sent2: I need a doodah to complete this project.
meanings.sent3: He mumbled something about a doodah, but I couldn't understand.
meanings.sent4: The box was filled with all sorts of doodahs and knickknacks.
meanings.sent5: She rummaged through the drawer looking for the elusive doodah.
